title: Phase 1: Implement Task File System Foundation
summary: Implement the foundational task file system that enables creating, reading, updating, and managing JSON task files. This is the core foundation that all other Cage features will build upon.

success_criteria.text: Task file schema defined and validated
Basic task CRUD API endpoints working
Can create, view, update, and list tasks

acceptance_checks.text: POST /tasks/confirm creates task file in tasks/ directory
CLI can create and list tasks

subtasks: Add basic CLI commands for task management

todo.text: Add basic CLI commands for task management

changelog.text: Phase 1 task created - implementing foundational task file system
Phase 1 completed successfully - task file system fully implemented and tested

decisions: Start with Phase 1 as it requires no external dependencies and provides immediate value
Focus on core task file operations before adding complex features
Use existing task file structure as foundation
issues_risks: Need to ensure task file schema matches Cage specification exactly
Should implement proper validation to prevent corrupted task files
Must handle concurrent access to task files safely
next_steps: Start with task file schema definition
Implement basic file operations for tasks
Test each component as it's built

metadata.future_work: Phase 2: Editor Tool - Build structured file operations (GET/INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE) with basic locking mechanism. This will enable actual file modifications through the API and integrate with the task system.
